Sentence: "You’re a wizard, Harry," Hagrid said with a tone of finality.
Harry stared at him in disbelief.
"An’ a thumpin’ good one, I’d say, once you’ve been trained up a bit."
He had spent eleven years being told he was nothing special, just a burden, an ordinary boy.
And now this giant was telling him he belonged to some magical world?
"But I can’t be a wizard," Harry insisted.
Hagrid let out a deep laugh.
"You’ll see," he said, "just wait until you get yer letter and go to Hogwarts.
